A quick history of why Emergency Coronavirus Relief package is delayed & where we‚Äôre at:

- Bipartisan Taskforce works on bill
- McConnell scraps bipartisan work & adds $500B slush fund
- Dems say no way
- Bipartisan talks resume, progress
- McConnell show votes slow things down

We're making progress on an emergency #coronavirus rescue plan. But show votes on McConnell‚Äôs $500B slushfund only slows things down. Dems are committed to helping all hardworking Americans, protecting taxpayers, delivering $ for states & hospitals, & saving our economy.

We need statesmanship, not a slush fund. A bipartisan solution is there to help people, hospitals, communities, & businesses. I urge Republicans to take it. We must act with urgency while also ensuring there will be real accountability & strong oversight now & in the days ahead.

Testing, testing, testing.
The Trump Admin‚Äôs epic failure to secure & deploy #coronavirus testing kits continues to hinder response & containment. Everyone should have access to testing & every hospital should be granted access to #PPE. We must speed assistance to those in need.

Helping health workers, hospitals, the unemployed, small businesses & states is key. It‚Äôs time for Sen McConnell to tear up his $500B #TrumpSlushFund & put #WorkersFirst. Congress must do the right thing in the midst of a pandemic & put people & Main Street ahead of Wall Street.
